body: The person who wrote this was not Grace. The person she was talking about couldn’t be me. This sort of drama didn’t happen to people like me. I didn’t even recognize half of the stuff in here. Where did this come from?

And why a monologue? Why write it down for some intro theatre assignment where she knew I was going to have to look at it and--what am I supposed to say about it!? This was something that children slid into the slits of lockers, or creeps hid under the windshield wipers of cars after work. I seethed in my chair, my head burning in frustration at the thought. I had no idea exactly what she thought I was going to make of this, but clearly she was living on a planet that wasn’t ours. It certainly wasn’t mine.
